abstract: Today’s nominal high in the Dow Jones industrial average still falls short of the inflation-adjusted peak in 2000.
snippet: Today’s nominal high in the Dow Jones industrial average still falls short of the inflation-adjusted peak in 2000.
lead_paragraph: The Dow Jones industrial average broke through 16,000 on Monday for the first time on record — well, at least in nominal terms. If you adjust for inflation, technically the highest level was on Jan. 14, 2000 (both for closing price and intraday trading):
